description: Analyze the AirQualityUCI dataset to explore temporal patterns, sensor correlations, and weather impacts.

turns.query: Load the dataset. First, drop any columns that do not have a proper name. Second, drop any rows where 'Date' or 'Time' is missing (NaN), as we cannot perform time series analysis without timestamps. Next, replace all occurrences of -200 with NaN in the remaining data. Finally, fill these sensor missing values using linear interpolation. Store the cleaned DataFrame in 'air_quality_cleaned'.

Using the cleaned data, perform a daily cycle analysis. Calculate the average 'CO(GT)' concentration for each hour of the day (0-23). Store the result in a Series named 'hourly_co_avg' indexed by hour.
Compare the average 'NOx(GT)' levels between Winter (months 12, 1, 2) and Summer (months 6, 7, 8). Store the result in a dictionary named 'seasonal_nox' with keys 'Winter' and 'Summer'.
Analyze the impact of weather. Calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient between Temperature 'T' and the sensor response 'PT08.S1(CO)'. Store the result in variable 'temp_sensor_corr'.

Use PCA to identify the most dominant pollutant trend. First, select all numeric sensor/pollutant columns (excluding Date, Time, T, RH, AH). Standardize the data (mean=0, std=1). Then, perform PCA and extract the loadings of the first principal component (PC1). Identify the feature name that has the highest absolute loading on PC1. Store this column name as a string in 'pc1_dominant_feature'.
